categories: Category:Articles that are known by a nickname

nodes.text: "Jek" was the nickname of a clone shock trooper who served in the Grand Army of the Republic during the Clone Wars. He served alongside Jedi Master Yoda on Rugosa. In 19 BBY, Jek served at the Battle of Kashyyyk.

Jek was one of the three clone troopers, alongside Clone Lieutenant Thire and Rys, who were dispatched to Rugosa as part of the escort accompanying Grand Master Yoda to secure an alliance between the Galactic Republic and King Katuunko of Toydaria. The group was ambushed by Separatist forces led by Asajj Ventress and, consequently, had to fight their way through her battle droid forces to reach the meeting point. In 19 BBY, Jek served under Clone Commander CC-1004 "Gree" at the Battle of Kashyyyk.

According to Master Yoda, Jek had an obsession with weapons, always thinking the strength of his team depended on having superior firepower. This mentality was reflected on his weapon of choice, the rotary blaster cannon. In the aftermath of their mission on Rugosa, Jek painted battle droid heads on his weapon.

In the Netflix subtitles of the Star Wars: The Clone Wars episode "Ambush," Jek's name was misspelled as "Jjeck."[source?] Author Jason Fry has stated that his intention was for Jek to be present on Kashyyyk at the time of Order 66 in Yoda's Force vision in "Sharing the Same Face," a 2020 adaptation of "Ambush."
